title: Andrew Johns' ex-wife Cathrine Mahoney defends Erin Molan
text:
The ex-wife of Andrew Johns has defended Erin Molan after the Channel Nine sports reporter was trolled by 'nasty types with a keyboard'.

Publicist Cathrine Mahoney took to Instagram to defend Erin, whom she met while they were both working at Nine in 2007.

'She was then, and is now, incredibly researched, hardworking, thorough, intelligent, thoughtful, caring, compassionate, smart and bloody hardworking,' Cathrine wrote.

'It's sad that nasty types with a keyboard are allowed to be so vile': Andrew Johns' ex-wife Cathrine Mahoney has defended Erin Molan. Pictured: Andrew and Catherine in 2007

She added: 'I am honoured to call her a friend. It's sad that nasty types with a keyboard are allowed to be so vile, but the reality is if you know Erin you know she is a top bird and someone you'd love to call friend.'

Cathrine and Andrew married in 2007 in a private ceremony, before splitting in 2015.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Cathrine Mahoney for comment.

'I had a rough night': It comes after Erin Molan broke down during a radio appearance on Thursday. Pictured on WSFM's Jonesy & Amanda

It comes after Molan broke down during a live radio appearance on Thursday.

The sportscaster, who has been subjected to awful online trolling over her 'rivalry' with Johns, told WSFM's Jonesy and Amanda she was having a 'rough' time.

'I am so sorry, I haven't put my contacts in this morning. I had a rough night. I didn't sleep very well and these are prescriptions,' Molan said, explaining why she was wearing dark sunglasses in the studio.

WSFM hosts Amanda Keller and Brendan 'Jonesy' Jones rallied behind Molan, who has a regular segment on their program.

Bad times: 'I am so sorry, I haven't put my contacts in this morning. I had a rough night. I didn't sleep very well,' Molan said, explaining why she was wearing dark sunglasses in the studio

The pair defended their guest host, who has been inundated with abuse on social media after her 'awkward' falling out with Johns was made public.

'I don't understand why people give you a hard time, it p***es me off,' Keller said as she choked back tears.

'I think it's because you are so professional, you are so good at your job and I think men don't like you being good in what they still see as their world,' she added.

'I admire the pants off you... I just think you are the most professional female and it's threatened everybody.'

Keller then praised her friend for her strength and took aim at her cowardly trolls.

Tension: Rugby league legend Andrew Johns reportedly doesn't get along with Molan (pictured) after she replaced Paul 'Fatty' Vautin on The Footy Show last year

'I just think in a few years' time people will look back - same as the Adam Goodes [booing] thing - and think, "What did we do to her? Why did we do that?"' she said.

Jones also showed his support for Molan, complimenting her on her achievements.

'I admire the pants off you as well and I'm a man and I know a lot of men and they all rate you so don't fill your head with these d**kheads that say these horrible things,' he said.

'You're such a nice person and I know you very well and I've known you before you reached the pinnacle of fame you have now.

'You're well qualified to do this and [the online abuse] will go away. But don't read the trolls, don't follow them [or] that junk.'

Support: Meanwhile, radio hosts Amanda Keller (pictured) and Brendan 'Jonesy' Jones rallied behind Molan, who has a regular segment on their program

Taking on the trolls: Jones (pictured) told Molan, 'Don't fill your head with these d**kheads that say these horrible things'

It comes amid reports Johns doesn't get along with Molan, who replaced Paul 'Fatty' Vautin on The Footy Show last year.

'Joey [Johns] has never been a fan of Erin, which isn't fair because she works her a**e off... The whole Footy Show thing, with Fatty being booted, that is where it started to go sour,' an insider previously told The Daily Telegraph.

Johns also removed himself from The Footy Show panel around the same time Vautin was replaced by Molan.

Personality clash? Johns (far right) removed himself from The Footy Show panel around the same time Paul 'Fatty' Vautin (not pictured) was replaced by Molan (left). Pictured during a Channel Nine broadcast with fellow commentator Ryan Girdler (centre)

Feud: On Wednesday, a source told Daily Mail Australia that Johns cannot stand the fact that Molan repeatedly interrupts her fellow Channel Nine commentators and giggles while on air

Meanwhile, Johns also cannot stand the fact that Molan repeatedly interrupts her fellow Channel Nine commentators and giggles while on air.

'He just doesn't like working with her,' a source told Daily Mail Australia on Wednesday.

'Joey is a stubborn bastard,' they added. 'If somewhere along the line she's p***ed him off he'll probably carry it around for the rest of his life.'

No comment: Johns (pictured), Molan and Channel Nine have denied the existence of any feud

Johns, Molan and Channel Nine have denied the existence of any feud.

Following reports of a feud, Molan has been widely criticised online by NRL fans, who have made it clear they would rather see Johns in the commentary box.

'I don't mind Erin, however, if I was the producer I would much prefer an immortal who can read and dissect the game and call things most others can't see than someone who has never played the game and reads the autocue,' one fan wrote on Facebook.
description: The ex-wife of Andrew Johns has defended Erin Molan after the Channel Nine sports reporter was trolled by 'nasty types with a keyboard'.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
